meanings.definition: Have an angry or sullen look on one's face.
meanings.sent1: She was glowering at her brother for breaking her toy.
meanings.sent2: The teacher caught the student glowering at the classmate who stole his pencil.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy cat was glowering at the new puppy in the house.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds were glowering over the horizon, threatening rain.
meanings.sent5: His glowering expression made everyone in the room uneasy.

meanings.definition: To look or stare with a sullen or threatening look.
meanings.sent1: The security guard was glowering at the suspicious person loitering near the entrance.
meanings.sent2: The old man glowered at the noisy teenagers disrupting the peace in the park.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy toddler started glowering at his vegetables during dinner.
meanings.sent4: The dragon glowered at the brave knight who dared to challenge it.
meanings.sent5: Her glowering eyes made it clear she was not in the mood for jokes.
